explanation:
1) metal_unused — Must examine the definition (macro or function) to ensure it does not modify the parameter variable 'params'. The call metal_unused(params) is the only use of the parameter in metal_sys_init; some implementations of an "unused" macro could (erroneously) perform an assignment or otherwise alter the pointer, which would violate the MISRA rule.

2) struct metal_init_params — Need the type declaration to confirm the qualification on the pointed-to object (e.g. const). Knowing whether params is declared as "const struct metal_init_params *" (pointer to const) or otherwise helps determine whether object modification would be permitted or attempted; it also clarifies whether any indirect dereference in the function (none present here) would be a const-violation.
